alert.note: Alert for Fannin; Gilmer; Murray; Whitfield (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 5:24PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Gilmer, Murray, northeastern Whitfield and northwestern Fannin Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 524 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Gap Springs to near Tilton, and moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Dalton, Chatsworth, Eton, Crandall, Sumac, Gregory, Cohutta Wilderness, Conasauga Lake, Tennga, Beaverdale, Dawnville, Cisco and Fort Mountain State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for north central and northwestern Georgia.
